Metadata: Effects of hypophysectomy and subsequent hormonal replacement therapy on hormonal and osmoregulatory status of coho salmon, "Oncorhynchus kisutch"

This study is the first to use hypophysectomy to investigate the possible hypophyseal control of plasma calcitonin, thyroxine, and triiodothyronin​e levels in coho salmon. Another objective is to investigate the effects of environmental salinity and of three hormones, thyroxine, growth hormone, and cortisol, and osmotic regulation, calcium regulation, gill Na+,K+-ATPase activity, and plasma levels of calcitonin, thyroxine, triidothyronine​, and cortisol.
